news_summary: Efforts to protect vulnerable groups are strengthening with Reddit implementing age verification for UK users to enhance online safety, while ongoing advocacy upholds women's rights to live free from violence, reinforcing commitments to human dignity and security. These measures reflect progress in safeguarding individual rights both digitally and socially.
news_summary_fr: Les efforts visant à protéger les groupes vulnérables se renforcent, Reddit mettant en œuvre la vérification de l'âge des utilisateurs britanniques afin d'améliorer la sécurité en ligne, tandis que la défense des droits des femmes à vivre sans violence se poursuit, renforçant ainsi les engagements en faveur de la dignité humaine et de la sécurité. Ces mesures reflètent les progrès accomplis dans la protection des droits individuels, tant sur le plan numérique que social.
news_summary_es: Los esfuerzos para proteger a los grupos vulnerables se están reforzando con la aplicación por parte de Reddit de la verificación de la edad de los usuarios británicos para mejorar la seguridad en línea, mientras que la defensa en curso defiende el derecho de las mujeres a vivir libres de violencia, reforzando los compromisos con la dignidad humana y la seguridad. Estas medidas reflejan los avances en la salvaguarda de los derechos individuales tanto en el ámbito digital como en el social.

articles.title: Reddit starts verifying ages of users in the UK
articles.summary: The platform will bring in the measures from 14 July to stop under-18s looking at "certain mature content".
articles.content:
Reddit starts verifying ages of users in the UK

Ofcom, the UK regulator, said: "We expect other companies to follow suit, or face enforcement if they fail to act."

Reddit, known for its online communities and discussions, said that while it does not want to know who its audience is: "It would be helpful for our safety efforts to be able to confirm whether you are a child or an adult."

The social media platform brought in the measures to comply with new rules under the UK's Online Safety Act which require sites that show adult material to introduce "robust" age checking techniques.

Reddit has introduced age verification on its UK site to stop people aged under 18 from looking at "certain mature content".

Reddit said that from 14 July, an outside firm called Persona will perform age verification for the social media platform either through an uploaded selfie or "a photo of your government ID", such as a passport.

It said Reddit will not have access to the photo and will only retain a user's verification status and date of birth so people do not have to re-enter it each time they try to access restricted content.

Reddit added that Persona "promises not to retain the picture for longer than seven days" and will not have access to a user's data on the site.

The new rules in the UK come into force on 25 July.

A spokesperson for Ofcom said: "Society has long protected youngsters from products that aren't suitable for them, from alcohol to smoking or gambling.

"Now, children will be better protected from online material that's not appropriate for them, while adults' rights to access legal content are preserved."

But Scott Babwah Brennen, director of the Center on Technology Policy at New York University, said: "There's always going to be ways that kids can get around it and there's always going to be concerns about who's collecting personal or sensitive information, and how long are they holding it."

David Greene, civil liberties director at the Electronic Frontier Foundation, said the UK's Online Safety Act was a "real tragedy".

"UK users can no longer use the internet without having to provide their papers, as it were," he said, adding that he was disappointed websites like Reddit were not legally challenging the law.

Pornhub and a number of other major adult websites recently confirmed they would introduce enhanced age checks in time for the new rules.

Pornhub's parent company, Aylo, said it would bring in "government approved age assurance methods" but is yet to reveal how it will require users to prove they are over 18.

Ofcom has previously said simply clicking a button, which is all the adult site currently requires, is not enough.

Companies that fail to meet the rules face fines of up to £18m or 10% of worldwide revenue, "whichever is greater".

It added that in the most serious cases, it can seek a court order for "business disruption measures", such as requiring payment providers or advertisers to withdraw their services from a platform, or requiring Internet Service Providers to block access to a site in the UK."
articles.reasoning: The article describes Reddit implementing age verification measures to protect minors from accessing mature content, aligning with new UK regulations aimed at safeguarding children online. While there are concerns about privacy and data collection, the overall intent is to enhance online safety for young users, which is a positive development in digital rights and child protection.
articles.personality_title: Reddit takes steps to keep kids safe with age checks in the UK
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context**
Reddit is a popular place where people join communities and share ideas online. New UK rules want to make sure kids don’t see adult content on sites like Reddit.

**What happened**
Starting July 14, Reddit will ask UK users to confirm their age to stop under-18s from viewing certain mature content.

**Impact**
This change helps protect young people by keeping adult content away from them, making Reddit a safer space for everyone.

**What's next step**
Other online companies in the UK are expected to follow Reddit’s example or face penalties from regulators if they don’t act.

**One-sentence takeaway**
Reddit’s new age checks bring a warm and welcome boost to online safety for children in the UK.
articles.personality_title_fr: Reddit prend des mesures pour assurer la sécurité des enfants avec des contrôles d'âge au Royaume-Uni
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Context**
Reddit est un endroit populaire où les gens rejoignent les communautés et partagent des idées en ligne. Les nouvelles règles britanniques veulent s'assurer que les enfants ne voient pas de contenu pour adultes sur des sites comme Reddit.

**ce qui s'est passé**
À partir du 14 juillet, Reddit demandera aux utilisateurs britanniques de confirmer leur âge pour empêcher les moins de 18 ans de consulter certains contenus matures.

**Impact**
Ce changement aide à protéger les jeunes en leur éloignant le contenu des adultes, ce qui fait de Reddit un espace plus sûr pour tout le monde.

**Quelle est la prochaine étape**
D'autres sociétés en ligne au Royaume-Uni devraient suivre l'exemple de Reddit ou faire face à des pénalités des régulateurs si elles n'agissent pas.

**à emporter à une phrase**
Les vérifications du Nouveau âge de Reddit apportent un coup de pouce chaleureux et bienvenu à la sécurité en ligne pour les enfants au Royaume-Uni.
articles.personality_title_es: Reddit toma medidas para mantener a los niños seguros con controles de edad en el Reino Unido
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**contexto**
Reddit es un lugar popular donde las personas se unen a las comunidades y comparten ideas en línea. Las nuevas reglas del Reino Unido quieren asegurarse de que los niños no vean contenido para adultos en sitios como Reddit.

**Qué pasó**
A partir del 14 de julio, Reddit pedirá a los usuarios del Reino Unido que confirmaran su edad para evitar que los menores de 18 años vean cierto contenido maduro.

**Impacto**
Este cambio ayuda a proteger a los jóvenes manteniendo el contenido de los adultos lejos de ellos, haciendo de Reddit un espacio más seguro para todos.

**¿Qué es el siguiente paso**?
Se espera que otras compañías en línea en el Reino Unido sigan el ejemplo de Reddit o enfrenten sanciones de los reguladores si no actúan.

**Control de una oración**
Los cheques de la New Age de Reddit traen un impulso cálido y bienvenido a la seguridad en línea para niños en el Reino Unido.

articles.title: Standing Firm on Women’s Right to Live Free of Violence
articles.summary:
Click to expand Image
          



  
        
  

        
                      
      
        
              Protesters march against gender-based violence in front of the Johannesburg Stock Exchange, South Africa, September 13, 2019.
                    © 2019 Alet Pretorius/Gallo Images via Getty Images
          
    


  
There’s no question about it--we are in the midst of a destructive global backlash against women’s rights.Against this regressive backdrop, the United Nations Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination against Women held its 91st Session in June and July. In addition to reviewing countries’ compliance with the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women (CEDAW), the committee also issued a statement on the need to stand firm in upholding existing international human rights law.The statement responds to an effort by some countries to develop a new optional protocol to CEDAW focused on gender-based violence. Any changes, the CEDAW Committee writes, “must be grounded in existing norms and standards.”Gender-based violence against women and girls violates CEDAW. As the CEDAW Committee wrote in 1992: “Gender-based violence is a form of discrimination that seriously inhibits women's ability to enjoy rights and freedoms on a basis of equality with men.”Pushing for such an instrument on rights already enshrined in international law and  amidst the global backlash against women’s rights, risks eroding rights firmly established under international law. The committee statement warns: “Any effort that creates a system of unequal protections among States Parties would jeopardize existing protections and guarantees under the Convention. The Committee is convinced that a new optional protocol might create a parallel process that could undermine full accountability under the Convention.”The backlash against women’s rights is happening in an alarming number of countries; UN Women reported in 2024 that one in four countries was experiencing such regression. The rollback on reproductive rights—from Romania to the United States and elsewhere—is just one example. It is also increasingly evident in international spaces such as the UN, where women’s rights are both targeted by anti-rights campaigners and harmed by slashed funding. A growing number of states are, in these spaces, working openly to weaken women’s rights protections.Women’s rights defenders around the world are still finding ways to make progress, while coming together to staunchly defend and apply international law, notably CEDAW, recognizing women’s right to equality. The CEDAW Committee’s words of caution deserve careful attention.As the committee states: “The principle of non-discrimination in the ⁠Convention covers gender-based violence against women and girls.”  The international instruments and interpretations are clear. What we need is for governments to fulfill their international legal obligations and stop all forms of violence against women.
articles.content:
Click to expand Image Protesters march against gender-based violence in front of the Johannesburg Stock Exchange, South Africa, September 13, 2019. © 2019 Alet Pretorius/Gallo Images via Getty Images

There’s no question about it--we are in the midst of a destructive global backlash against women’s rights.

Against this regressive backdrop, the United Nations Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination against Women held its 91st Session in June and July. In addition to reviewing countries’ compliance with the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women (CEDAW), the committee also issued a statement on the need to stand firm in upholding existing international human rights law.

The statement responds to an effort by some countries to develop a new optional protocol to CEDAW focused on gender-based violence. Any changes, the CEDAW Committee writes, “must be grounded in existing norms and standards.”

Gender-based violence against women and girls violates CEDAW. As the CEDAW Committee wrote in 1992: “Gender-based violence is a form of discrimination that seriously inhibits women's ability to enjoy rights and freedoms on a basis of equality with men.”

Pushing for such an instrument on rights already enshrined in international law and amidst the global backlash against women’s rights, risks eroding rights firmly established under international law. The committee statement warns: “Any effort that creates a system of unequal protections among States Parties would jeopardize existing protections and guarantees under the Convention. The Committee is convinced that a new optional protocol might create a parallel process that could undermine full accountability under the Convention.”

The backlash against women’s rights is happening in an alarming number of countries; UN Women reported in 2024 that one in four countries was experiencing such regression. The rollback on reproductive rights—from Romania to the United States and elsewhere—is just one example. It is also increasingly evident in international spaces such as the UN, where women’s rights are both targeted by anti-rights campaigners and harmed by slashed funding. A growing number of states are, in these spaces, working openly to weaken women’s rights protections.

Women’s rights defenders around the world are still finding ways to make progress, while coming together to staunchly defend and apply international law, notably CEDAW, recognizing women’s right to equality. The CEDAW Committee’s words of caution deserve careful attention.

As the committee states: “The principle of non-discrimination in the ⁠Convention covers gender-based violence against women and girls.” The international instruments and interpretations are clear. What we need is for governments to fulfill their international legal obligations and stop all forms of violence against women.
articles.reasoning: While the article highlights a concerning global backlash against women's rights and gender-based violence, it also emphasizes the ongoing efforts by the UN Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination against Women and women's rights defenders worldwide to uphold international law and protect women's rights. This demonstrates resilience, commitment, and hope for progress despite challenges.
articles.personality_title: United nations stand strong to protect women’s rights worldwide
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context**
Women’s rights are facing challenges around the world, with some places rolling back protections and others trying to weaken international laws.

**What happened**
The United Nations Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination against Women recently met and reminded everyone that existing rules against gender-based violence must be kept strong and respected.

**Impact**
This firm stance helps protect women everywhere by making sure countries stick to agreements that stop violence and discrimination.

**What's next step**
The committee encourages governments to fully follow international laws and work hard to end violence against women and girls.

**One-sentence takeaway**
Despite setbacks, global efforts keep pushing forward to ensure women live free from violence and discrimination.
articles.personality_title_fr: Les Nations Unies sont fortes pour protéger les droits des femmes dans le monde entier
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Context**
Les droits des femmes sont confrontés à des défis dans le monde, avec certains endroits qui ont renvoyé les protections et d'autres essayant d'affaiblir les lois internationales.

**ce qui s'est passé**
Le Comité des Nations Unies sur l'élimination de la discrimination à l'égard des femmes a récemment rencontré et a rappelé à chacun que les règles existantes contre la violence fondée sur le sexe devaient être tenues fortes et respectées.

**Impact**
Cette position d'entreprise aide à protéger les femmes du monde entier en s'assurant que les pays s'en tiennent à des accords qui arrêtent la violence et la discrimination.

**Quelle est la prochaine étape**
Le comité encourage les gouvernements à suivre pleinement les lois internationales et à travailler dur pour mettre fin à la violence contre les femmes et les filles.

**à emporter à une phrase**
Malgré les revers, les efforts mondiaux continuent d'avancer pour garantir que les femmes vivent sans violence et discrimination.
articles.personality_title_es: Las Naciones Unidas se mantienen firmes para proteger los derechos de las mujeres en todo el mundo
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**contexto**
Los derechos de las mujeres enfrentan desafíos en todo el mundo, con algunos lugares retrocediendo las protecciones y otros tratando de debilitar las leyes internacionales.

**Qué pasó**
El Comité de las Naciones Unidas sobre la eliminación de la discriminación contra las mujeres recientemente cumplió y recordó a todos que las reglas existentes contra la violencia basada en el género deben mantenerse fuertes y respetadas.

**Impacto**
Esta postura firme ayuda a proteger a las mujeres en todas partes asegurándose de que los países cumplan con los acuerdos que detienen la violencia y la discriminación.

**¿Qué es el siguiente paso**?
El comité alienta a los gobiernos a seguir completamente las leyes internacionales y trabajar duro para poner fin a la violencia contra las mujeres y las niñas.

**Control de una oración**
A pesar de los contratiempos, los esfuerzos globales siguen avanzando para garantizar que las mujeres vivan libres de violencia y discriminación.
